bibl.title: Jewish Inscriptions of Graeco-Roman Egypt. With an Index of the Jewish Inscriptions of Egypt and Cyrenaica.
bibl.note: Collection of 156 inscriptions, based on the Egyptian section of C.I.Jud., and the revised and supplemented texts published in C.P.Jud. III. - Pp. 227-250: Appendices 1-3. Inscriptions not considered to be Jewish; - Inscriptions from outside Egypt; - Jewish names in pagan inscriptions.
bibl.seg: HORBURY William and David NOY, Jewish Inscriptions of Graeco-Roman Egypt. With an Index of the Jewish Inscriptions of Egypt and Cyrenaica.
Cambridge, University Press, 1992, 8°, xxiv-378 pp. et XXXII pll. ISBN 0-521-41870-4. £60.

Collection of 156 inscriptions, based on the Egyptian section of C.I.Jud., and the revised and supplemented texts published in C.P.Jud. III. - Pp. 227-250: Appendices 1-3. Inscriptions not considered to be Jewish; - Inscriptions from outside Egypt; - Jewish names in pagan inscriptions.
S.E.G. XLII, 1501; XLIII, 1097 (C.R. par Hélène Cuvigny); XLV, 2033 (C.R. par Aryeh Kasher).

C.R. par Hélène Cuvigny, REG 106 (1993) pp. 655-657. - Aryeh Kasher, Gnomon 67 (1995) pp. 276-278. - Adam Lajtar, JJurP 24 (1994) pp. 57-70. - Gerard Mussies, BibO 52 (1995) coll. 774-778. - Jonathan J. Price, SCI 13 (1994) pp. 179-180. - Charlotte Roueché, JRS 83 (1993) pp. 248-249. - G.H.R. Horsley, Jewish Studies Quarterly 2 (1995) No. 1, pp. 77-101 (non vidimus). - Bruce W. Winter, JThS N.S., 48 (1997) pp. 216-217.
